ovdesc.p: The table is used to hold details related to addenda for all the sec class codes which have addenda records available.
The table specifies the number of addenda records available for the sec class code and the fields that are mandatory when the message type has an addenda record.
It also holds the default values to be updated in the fields captured in the table while creating an ACH.ADDENDA record

desc.p: ID can only be a valid type of sec class code.
Validation Rules
Maximum length is 3
Field to capture the name of the field in ACH.ADDENDA that will have to be input for the class code.
The total addenda count will be considered from the count of the multi-values in the ACH.ADDENDA record for the field mentioned in this table.

Instead of the field based count, a number can also be input here, in which case the system will check if there are that many addenda fields updated in the ACH.ADDENDA table while generating outward transactions
Validation Rules
No validation
The field carries the value upto 3 character as per the addenda records available.
The first digit denotes the RECORD.TYPE.CODE and the last two digits denote the ADDENDA.TYPE.CODE for the particular sec class code.
When more than one addenda record is available, this can be multi valued.
Validation Rules
Multivalue field, upto 3 characters
This is an optional field used for the SEC codes having optional addenda apart from the mandatory ones mentioned in the field ORDER.
Validation Rules
Multivalue field, upto 3 characters
For every value mentioned in the field ORDER, the SEQ.FLD.MAP, PROPERTY and DEFAULT.VAL have to be mentioned.
This field carries the values given in the field ORDER.
Validation Rules
Multivalue field, upto 3 characters
Allows attaching any routines for manipulating the sequence number to be populated while generating the outward file.
Wherever the sequence number generation is different for a Sec class code, a routine can be attached to this field to generate the sequence number.
The routine attached should accept single argument.
Validation Rules
Multivalue field associated with SEQUENCE and must be a valid API, upto 35 characters
The sub value set from SEQ.FLD.MAP to DEFAULT.VAL holds the value required to be displayed in ACH.ADDENDA.
The field SEQ.FLD.MAP should be a valid field name from the application ACH.ADDENDA.
Validation Rules
Multivalue field associated with SEQUENCE
This field is used to validate if the field mentioned in SEQ.FLD.MAP is mandatory, required or optional.
Possible values are M, R, O
M - Mandatory
R - Required
O - Optional
Validation Rules
Multivalue field associated with SEQUENCE
When the field is set to M or R, while validating the ACH.ADDENDA record system will check if a value exists for this field, else system will thow 'INPUT MISSING' error message
This field specifies the position of the field taken from the standard selection record of ACH.ADDENDA.
For internal use
Validation Rules
No input field.
This is an optional field used to update the ACH.ADDENDA version with default values.
In case the SEQ.FLD.MAP field is given mandatory or required, this field is checked for default values to be populated.
If values are not available, an error is thrown.
Validation Rules
No validation.
Allows attaching any routines for manipulating the sequence number to be populated while generating the Detail records (prefixed 6) in outward file.
The general logic will be available in the outward generation service.
Wherever the sequence number generation is different for a Sec class code, a routine can be attached here.
The routine attached should accept single argument.
Multivalue field associated with SEQUENCE and must be a valid API, upto 35 characters
